Posts.Title: Diagnosed with a 5 cm solid mass in left breast cspiritl Fergy

Posts.Content: May 17, 2012 10:41AM cspiritl wrote: Hello Ladies, I had a apt this morning and received a phone call while getting ready. It was the biopsy results, she said they were benign!!!  She didn't have the report yet but the pathologist called and told her that.  I want to thank all you wonderful women for your prayers and good company during the time i was worried and afraid. I will keep all of you in my daily prayers. I love that you are a wonderful family here. They will do a follow up mamo in 6-months, might still have to get the ductogram, it my primary requests it.  I hope you ladies would not mind if i pop in every now and then to say hello :) God Bless all of you women with courage, strength, peace, hope!

Diagnosed with a 5 cm solid mass in left breast cspiritl Fergy

Posts.Content: May 11, 2012 10:03PM cspiritl wrote: That's what i have done Joy, believing it is just a growth, in which i am sure it is. You ladies have been wonderfully supportive! And I think you for that.  I have 6 beautiful grown children and four beautiful Grandchildren! They have kept me busy and put a smile on my face. I was in such shock when I found out that I was numb. Took about 4 day for it to really hit me. I gave myself 5 minute to cry and compose myself. But most of all it has kept me in prayer!! God is good and merciful.

Posts.Content: May 15, 2012 12:29PM cspiritl wrote: I just wanted to add, when getting the biopsy, the tech and rad said when the numbed me with lanacane that the nipple ducts were connected to the large area, because they could see the numbing stuff go from one area to other.They actually said that it was not 5cm, but from one end to the other many area's growths. I hope i have explained this to where you ladies understand. Had a rough night last night. They said what ever it is that that the growth and ducts go together.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with a 5 cm solid mass in left breast cspiritl Fergy

Posts.Content: cspiritl wrote: Hello everyone! I went for my routine mamo and was called by my primary Dr the very next morning.  They wanted to do diagnostic mamo and sono. It took 19 days to get the apt. i went this last Monday and after test radiologist came into room and was recommending a Sonogram biopsy. He said I had a 5 cm solid mass in the left breast. I am 52 and have been on estrogen for the last 3 years, for menopause. Which my primary took me off immediately after getting results from Radiologist. I have been doing some research until i go get my biopsy on this coming Monday. I was some what concerned until i came across a internet side talking about large solid mass possibly being Fibroadenoma.Oh I should also mention I have had liquid stuff coming out of my breast for years off and on. The day i had my first Mammogram i had bleeding from my nipple for a week.  So with all this said I have been very concerned, and hoping maybe someone might have some of the same thing happen with them. Thank you so much for taken the time to read my concerns.   Worried in Arizona :) Hope to hear from you all.. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with a 5 cm solid mass in left breast cspiritl Fergy

Posts.Content: May 11, 2012 09:43PM cspiritl wrote: Thank you GrandmaV,  my mass is large but I can't feel it. It is at 7 oclock and 4 cm from the nipple. They did a bunch of measuring. I have my mamo's ever year. And never had all this done before. I had cancer in 98 and had a hysterectomy but kept my ovaries. Are the biopsies very painful?  Thank you for listening to me ramble on..  :)

Posts.Title: anyone out there with auto-immune/chronic pain issues before dx? jessamine SuzyBlue

Posts.Content: May 12, 2012 12:19AM cspiritl wrote: I am new here and going through the forums and came across this one. I have not been diagnosed with BC yet still in testing process, and praying that it reveals nothing bad :(I wrote about it in the newbe forum. But to add to this topic, i have lupus, fibro, sjogrens, and Reynolds. I thought the bad news for me was last year, when i was told my main aorta heart valve was leaking. But I don't thing anything I have been through this far has scared me more then being told I have a solid 5 cm mass in my left breast. My thought go out to all of you ladies here. I will be adding all of you to my prayers. So glad I found this site!!
